name: Holiday Inn Tewksbury Andover

reviews.text: Got here late (almost midnight) and we were checked in to our two rooms quickly. I see people are saying this HI was recently renovated, but it didn't really look like it was. There was NO soap at all in our room but my daughter had two in her room so she gave us one so I wouldn't have to call down and wait for someone to deliver it. The shampoo in my daughter's room was mostly gone. I guess they don't check to see what toiletries are left after each guest. Also the air conditioner does make a racket every time it kicks in...I kept thinking it was thunder. But the room was clean and there was breakfast included. We were only staying here one night on our way up to Maine so it was sufficient for that.
reviews.title: Okay, but..

reviews.text: What can you say about a Holiday Inn. Well last year we stayed at this property and it was a great value for the money because they were remodelling. This year the remodel is finished and it was lovely. There was a me-first wedding party in the lobby which made check in a little difficult but the staff was calm, welcoming and gracious. The room was great and quiet. For heading North to Maine it is a great stopping off point.
reviews.title: Our Second Stay and Yes, we will be back

reviews.text: We will definitely stay there again if they have rooms available.
reviews.title: rude rude rude

reviews.text: I have a novel of things gone wrong from the internet not working to being lied to about the breakfast provided to the fitness center being in the dank basement, the pool has kids that come during the day for swim lessons so unless you like to swim in merky water....
reviews.title: It was a decent hotel, but the AC was a bit loud

reviews.text: also kids were allowed to run through the halls screaming until 2am ...... and I was repeatedly told for 4 hours to just give them time to settle down ....... UM hello how about NO WAY!!! The price way exceeds the hotels offerings and the restaurant is empty for a reason.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay with helpful staff

reviews.text: As part of a business trip, we were booked into this hotel so didn't have a choice. When the itinerary details came through, I checked the reviews on Tripadvisor and my heart sank. First impressions of the hotel pretty much matched some of the comments left by other visitors. Yes, the corridors are scruffy but work will shortly start to modernise these. However, most of the rooms have now been renovated and the hotel plans to improve the facilities even more. Every visitor has a list of 'must haves' from an hotel. Quality of the beds and the bed linen is top of my list and I can't fault the Holiday Inn on this. They even have a pillow menu! The showers are good and the bathrooms are roomy. However, the real value is in the quality of the service. The people who work in this hotel are exceptional. Nothing is too much trouble and they certainly know the meaning of the phrase 'going the extra mile'. Yes, they have some issues but they are listening to their customers which tells me a lot about their values and aspirations to make this hotel the best value for money hotel in the Boston area.
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

reviews.text: I feel some sympathy for the contractor on the remodel of this hotel; it looks like the building was allowed to go realllllly far downhill, and my guess is that the remodeling budget is well short of what it needs to be. The result is what you have here.
reviews.title: When they're done remodeling, will it really be that much better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As of early September, construction is the big story with this Holiday Inn. The first couple of floors appear to be entirely under renovation, and some sections of floors 3 and 4 are, too. We're talking serious work: Hallway carpets covered in plastic sheets, rooms essentially gutted. Much more of this is visible to guests than you'd imagine, and the smell of paint just permeates the whole place. (It's a sealed building, so I could turn up the fan in my room ... but with no windows to open, I was going to sleep with that smell.)
reviews.title: Vacation from Hell

reviews.text: I'd be willing to let all of this slide as a temporary condition, but the deeper problems trouble me: There's still a whole lot of hotel that needs overhaul. The elevators are pretty beat, the pool area is powerfully ugly. (Extra-high ceilings .. but the walls are a grim beige cinderblock, the lighting is cheap flourescent, and the overall feel is of a prison showerroom from some depressing movie).
reviews.title: In middle of a rennovation, so it could have been better.

reviews.text: Maybe there's a local ordinance on pool safety, or maybe they've had some bad history with accidents or lawsuits. But their pool system is just weird: It's only open from 4 to 10 p.m., and STAFFED. But not with a lifeguard; with a check-in clerk who mostly pays no attention to anything once you've signed the list. You get your own towel, there are no locker keys to hand out - so the attendant evidently has nothing to do except verify you belong there. It's a spacious pool area, but the pool itself & especially the whirlpool were a bit messy - leaves or other debris. I can't imagine the hotel has many people trying to sneak into its pool, so who knows what's up with the attendant & the ridiculously limited hours of operation?
reviews.title: Don't book! Awful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attended a luncheon as a guest. Extremely impressed with the staff, the facility, the quality, and the obvious care that was taken. The Holiday Inn staff definitely made a huge effort. Everything was clean and in order and attractive. The staff was extremely kind and paid attention to every detail. When I walked into the function room, everything was arranged immaculately. The quality of the food was wonderful. The arrangement was terrific. Everything was in order and in place, and I and all the guests felt beautifully taken care of. I can't remember when I've been so impressed. This Holiday Inn was warm and comfortable and relaxing from the minute I stepped into the front door. They obviously have a gem of a staff. Very impressed.
reviews.title: Remarkable staff.

reviews.text: Reading the reviews made me a little nervous especially when I was told there was construction going on, but we had a great stay. The people were very helpful and explained the problem with the previous kitchen construction. The work being done on the hotel now is a by a contractor who answers to them so there were no problems. The room was very comfortable. The rate was so reasonable that breakfas for two, a pub visit and the room cost totaled what most rooms do!
reviews.title: Great price for a great place

reviews.text: The hotel was in terrible shape. The hallways smelled like cigarette smoke and body odor. The work out room is hidden away in the basement, and it's creepy and small. Several of the machines were broken. There is renovation in progress, and they need to hurry up. Awful. Every time I had to talk to someone at the front desk there was a 15 minute wait.
reviews.title: Needs renovation - Avoid this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is renovating and desperately needs a lot of work. Every area appears old, cracked, chipped and worn. Many rooms are in process and the trade-name continues to draw unsuspecting clients. Our room smelled like cigarette smoke. The manager's response was "sometimes people ignore our rules, but we have no other rooms available". So avoid this hotel until work is finished
reviews.title: Warning - Find a different hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed there for a few nights while sightseeing in Boston, MA. Well, I didn't encounter any problems with the parking lot but maybe it's cause we were parked next door to the front desk... The hotel itself is ok and some rooms were renovated so it's quite good 3-star standard. I can't stay the hotel was bad but it's definitely too far away from Boston and next time I'd consider finding something closer to the town. There are also no shops, shoping centres etc. nearby, just the Interstate. Though with good price deal I can't really complaint and it was quite good stay.
reviews.title: Too far away from Boston and in the middle of nowhere. Still a good deal!

reviews.text: I visit my daughter in Maine once a year.It is a ten hour hike so I look for a spot where I can get a soft bed,a cool room,and a clean bathroom.This is the joint..It is situated in a corporate center with office buildings to the right or left.So don't worry about the poster who spoke of vandalism.It is not a blighted area,on the contrary it is an upscale corporate area.Well after 6 hours on the road this lumbering oaf was ready for some well deserved sleep.I navigated through New Jersey.If you can drive on any interstate in New Jersey .287,GSP,440,195,80 you can drive anywhere in the world.New York City is an easier drive,all be it with more traffic.Anyway hotel was SLIGHTLY worn,looked like a college dorm,but who cares,Had plenty of good eateries in the area,and bottom line,"I got nothing to complain about":
reviews.title: A Decent Shack for the Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've attended several weddings at this Holiday Inn, but the most recent one was especially hospitable and inviting. The venue is finely appointed for a cocktail reception and the perfect comfortable size for dinner & dancing for about 125 people. The bride and groom chose to serve a buffet, and the food was wonderful. The rooms are clean, spacious, and quiet. The restaurant was perfect for breakfast in the morning, hot breakfast buffet was a value and quick compared to ordering off the menu. There were quite a few of us, so it was the welcome alternative, so we could linger awhile and chat. Overall, the staff was friendly and accommodating. We needed extra towels, and they were quickly delivered to the room. Over all these year, this hotel continues to be an anchor in the community -- always consistent, friendly, and the food is GREAT!
reviews.title: Perfect venue for a wedding reception

reviews.text: I stay in different hotels all over New England and this is the best hotel by far. The best service, attitude, employees and overall quality.
reviews.title: The best Holiday Inn I stay at

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one night as a business traveler. It is located in the heart of Merrimack Valley and a perfect destination after hours of a long day business meetings. Though far from Boston city it provides good service, beautifully appointed facilitities and many attractions of the Merrimack Valley including the Tsongas Arena, Lowell Memorial Auditorium, shopping and golf.
reviews.title: All the amenities for a perfect stay!

reviews.text: We decided to stay at this Hotel due to rate being within our budget. When we arrived there I was quite happy with the quick check in and the beautiful Lobby, not what you usually see in a Holiday Inn. Anyway, we got a room that was recently renovated and WOW! It was beautiful! It looked like I was staying at a Hilton or similar. It even had a subtle "new stuff" smell in the room. In the morning we went down for breakfast and everybody was so accomodating in the restaurant - excellent service specially when you have kids you NEED all the help. The check out experience was easy and quick since I already had my receipt under my door first thing in the morning. I will be staying at this hotel anytime I come to MA and would definitely recommend it to anyone. Two thumbs up!
reviews.title: Better than your average Holiday Inn, a pleasant surprise!

aka: Holiday Inn Tewksbury Andover Hotel Tewksbury
description: Located in the heart of the Merrimack Valley, the renovated (2011)Holiday Inn Tewksbury/Andover MA hotel is the perfect choice for business or leisure travel. This upscale property provides travelers with exceptional service, beautifully appointed facilities and prime access to businesses, such as Raytheon, Avid, Hewlett Packard and Motorola, as well as many attractions of the Merrimack Valley including the Tsongas Arena, Lowell Memorial Auditorium, shopping and golf. The hotel is located off Route 133, near the junction of I-495 and I-93. The hotel is less than 30 miles from Boston Logan Airport as well as Manchester Boston Regional Airport and only a few miles from the Lowell train & bus stations. The Holiday Inn Tewksbury/Andover hotel features 227 nicely decorated guestrooms. All rooms offer standard amenities including free high speed Internet access. With our personal service and thoughtful attention to detail, the Holiday Inn Tewksbury/Andover hotel offers all the extras to make your stay pleasurable. Our own Victoria's Restaurant serves popular American cuisine and is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The English Pub offers a lighter selection of food and drink in a more casual atmosphere. Relax in our indoor lap pool and Jacuzzi or keep up with your exercise routine in our fitness room. The hotel offers a courtesy van for local business travel and ample complimentary parking. All the elements for a perfect stay!
